intro: Trigastrotheca pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leaf buttercup, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, palmately lobed leaves and yellow flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
